com.tailf.navu

Class NavuContext

  • Object
    • com.tailf.navu.NavuContext

  • public class NavuContext
extends Object
    This class abstracts the means of how NAVU should populates its tree.

    There could be 3 type of modes that NAVU could run in.

  • Maapi MODE - the mode in which the tree is populated through a current transaction. Read and writes is done on the transaction specified by th it could either be a attached transaction or it could be a transaction explicitly opened.
  • Cdb MODE - the mode in which the tree is populated through Cdb read session in running/operational data store. In this mode the read and writes is done through the CDB API and is driven by internal implicitly opened Cdb sockets and CdbSessions which is handled by the NavuCdbSessionPool.

    A user could either read from (running/operational) or writes (operational) Cdb data without explicitly starting new CdbSessions.

    The supplied Cdb socket is used as a template for opening new Cdb sockets by the NavuCdbSessionPool. The host and port is used from the supplied Cdb socket to connect to desired host on a effective Cdb socket.

    The supplied socket is never touched by the NAVU instead it is mapped to one or more effective Cdb sockets , max 4 ( for each data store available). Each effective Cdb sockets open a session against a different data store.

  • CdbSession MODE - this mode is used when the supplied CdbSession is constructed and should be used for populating the tree. The CdbSession will be the effective session and NAVU will use it as much as possible.
    • This class is container for the communication channels used by a NAVU.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NavuContext

        public NavuContext(Cdb cdb)
        Constructor for running NAVU with the Cdb mode.

        As this constructor takes a Cdb but it is never touched i.e no new Cdb sessions are opened on the supplied socket. Instead a new Cdb socket is constructed and used for new sessions.

        The Cdb sockets will be named "supplied-name"-pool:x where "supplied-name" is the name of the supplied Cdb socket name ( cdb.getName() ). The string "-pool:x" is appended where x is a internal integer counter.

        Parameters:
        cdb - The Cdb socket used as the template or NavuContext

      • NavuContext

        public NavuContext(CdbSession session)
        CDB Session constructor.
        Parameters:
        session -

      • NavuContext

        public NavuContext(Maapi m,
           int handle)
        Constructor for running NAVU with the Maapi mode.

        As this constructor takes a transaction handle as its second parameter it implies that either a attached transaction is used or a started transaction is opened.

        Parameters:
        m - the Maapi instance to be used
        handle - the transaction handle used for this NavuContext

      • NavuContext

        public NavuContext(Maapi readWrite,
           int readWriteTid,
           Maapi readOnly,
           int readOnlyTid)
        Dual MAAPI constructor. This mode is used when you want be able to read nodes that have been changed in current transaction.
        Parameters:
        readWrite - - a read write socket.
        readWriteTid -
        readOnly - - a read only on the RUNNING.
        readOnlyTid -

      • getBackingStoreCdb

        public Cdb getBackingStoreCdb()
        Get the backing store Cdb instance. The backing store Cdb is actually never used, instead it is used as master for the internal NavuCdbSessionPool. The reason for this is that NAVU needs several CdbSessions concurrently and a Cdb instance can only hold one open CdbSession
        Returns:
        backing store Cdb if applicable for this context

      • getBackingStoreCdbSession

        public CdbSession getBackingStoreCdbSession()
        Get the backing store CdbSession in this context was based on this. Otherwise this method returns null. Creating a context based on a CdbSession is an alternative to creating context based on a Cdb instance. If the CdbSession option is used, this session will be the backing store session and also its related Cdb instance is retrieved and stored as backing store Cdb instance. This CdbSession is never used by NAVU, instead it is master for the internal NavuCdbSessionPool.
        Returns:
        backing store CdbSession if applicable for this context

      • getCdb

public Cdb getCdb()
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated, use getBackingStoreCdb() instead
        Returns:
        backing store Cdb if applicable for this context

      • set

        public void set(NavuContext context)
        Set the context attributes using another context object.

        This this operation will make an abrupt change in connection type, transactions etc. Therefore it is the responsibility of the user to handle open transactions, locks, socket or any other resources that otherwise will be left orphaned.

        Note, that the context is normally set at the creation of the NAVU root node. The context is then shared between all child nodes and a change of context attributes will therefore affect all nodes in the current NAVU tree. This implies that data can become stale between maapi transactions or cdb locks and the it is the responsibility of the user to handle when and how stale data should be dismissed.

        Parameters:
        context -

      • setLockingMode

        Set the locking mode on CDB Oper Sessions
        Parameters:
        enable - locking mode if true.
